bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Harry L. Freer, June 25, 1941

div1.p: Hench is seeking copies of Camp Columbia maps for himself and for the Cuban Chief of Engineers of Military City.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Harry L. Freer, June 25, 1941
div1.opener:
June 25, 1941
Mr. Harry L. Freer
War Department
Office of the Chief of Engineers
Washington, D. C.
My dear Mr. Freer:
div1.p:
I had some correspondence with you some months ago in an attempt to
locate some of the old maps of Camp Columbia or Columbia Barracks, Havana, Cuba,
as of 1899-1902. You were kind enough to send me a copy of the 1902 map but
could not find the key to this map. In an attempt to find this or maps of Camp
Columbia earlier than 1902, I visited the Chief of Engineers at Ciudad Militar,
Havana, Cuba, and I found tattered blueprints of the three maps, small photographs
of which I had taken. The photographs are merely portions of the map as I was
interested chiefly in the eastern end of Columbia Barracks. They had no extra
copies nor did they have the original from which the blueprints were made.
Do you have in your department the originals of these three maps, and if so,
would it be possible for me to have one or two blueprints of each of them? The
one I have marked “A” is the 1899 map, the one marked “B” is the 1901 modification
of the 1899 map and the one marked “C” is a property map of Columbia Barracks,
dated 1902.

In an attempt to locate the key to the 1902 map I stopped over in Wash-
ington a couple of months ago and former Surgeon-General Ireland took me to the
Map Collection of the War Department, in the Army War College. The sergeant in
charge showed me an 1898 map of Columbia Barracks and two 1899 maps. They did not
have any of the ones that I enclose nor did they have the key to the 1902 map.
The sergeant in charge could not at the moment find the original of his three
maps--the 1898 one and the two 1899 maps. Do you know whether these originals
are in your office and if so, could I obtain a couple of blueprints of them?

The Chief of Engineers of the Military City at Havana (the Military
City being the headquarters of the Cuban army) was anxious to have me find out
whether I could locate the above mentioned maps. They did not have them in their
own collection and are so anxious to obtain copies of them. from you if at all
possible, to complete their own collection. I have the films of the three fragments,
photographs of which are enclosed, and should you wish further copies, I will be
glad to have them made for you.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
